spiritsExplanation:
The workout's spirit is determined by several key elements in the metadata. The title "August Race: Week 4 of 5" and the description indicating an explosive and intense effort for the final one-minute piece with max rhythm of 30, positioned alongside an intensity level of 3 out of 3, strongly suggest a 'High-Energy & Intense' spirit. The focus on power, speed, and all-out effort aligns with this classification, resulting in a score of 0.9 for this spirit.

The imagery of rowing on an actual river, as indicated in the picture, links to 'Outdoor & Adventure.' The outdoor setting adds an adventurous feel to the exercise, contributing to a score of 0.7, but slightly less than high-intensity due to the focus on intensity in the description.

The playlist featuring high-energy, rhythmic dance music suggests a 'Flow & Rhythm' element. Songs by artists like RÜFÜS DU SOL and Martin Garrix indicate a strong musical tempo, which complements the rhythm-focused max drive. Thus, Flow & Rhythm is awarded a score of 0.6.

The 'Structured & Disciplined' spirit isn't emphasized here, as no specific technical or progressive training elements are highlighted. Similarly, the absence of restorative elements excludes 'Soothing & Restorative,' while there is no mention of sports-specific drills, thus 'Sport & Agility' is also not considered applicable.
